text: tis the season for college graduations
in America and everywhere newly minted
graduates are giving themselves a pat on
the back okay let's stop right there
it's time to talk about debt the Pew
Research Center recently analyzed a
whole bunch of government data then
here's what they found about 40% of
younger US households have student debt
and the median amount is about $13,000
now take a look at this young
college-educated households without
student debt have a net worth that's
seven times greater than those with debt
seven times it doesn't stop there
Pew Research found that college-educated
folks with student debt are actually
more likely to have other types of debt
here's a whopper of a number this is the
median amount of overall debt they have
now compare that same figure for
college-educated people who don't have
student loans but why is student debt
more likely to bring on other debt Pew
Research thinks one reason is because
student loans make it harder for young
adults to gain financial traction in
other areas of their lives so is
University worth all this well a typical
college graduate with student debt still
earns nearly twice as much as someone
with student debt who didn't earn a
bachelor's degree and you know what 63%
of people with student debt say the
education has paid off of course for
those who didn't have to borrow well
they're a little more optimistic
David Botti BBC News Washington
